comment: Where is Grok Code Fast 1?

The latest UI update is terrible. I can no longer see the essential responses from copilot. It's unusable. The recent updates were stable, but it seems to have reverted to the early days. Why did the UI/UX team allow this?

Its a HUGE pity that the Github Copilot team responsible for the UI is not doing proper Quality Assurance before realsing new features. I have just got the latest version and the chat area is broken. This is not the first time I have complained on this forum. Please have a talk with the QA team as they are letting lots of broken UI to go to pass in the JetBrains products and if this continues you are going to lose customers!

The GUI of the pop up is completely ruined. I can't scroll down to my most recent prompt. The input box completely covers 5 to 6 lines generated by the LLM. This update made this plugin unusable in IDEA IntelliJ.

After the latest update (v1.5.54-243), the plugin consistently fails to provide the entire response in Rider (v2024.3.8). Changing models doesn't help, restarting IDE doesn't help. Only the most basic responses are shown fully, the moment it needs to provide a bit longer response, far from anything complex, it is truncated. Just to be clear, this has nothing to do with quotas or premium models or anything, I am nowhere near any limits, just simple chat (Ask mode). Based on the other reviews, I am not the only one. Cmon guys, you can't be shipping this to people who rely on Copilot to get their work done. I had to switch back to VS (hopefully temporarily).

After the latest automatic update, the generated code consistently fails to render properly—only a full IDE restart temporarily fixes it. And this bug happens with alarming frequency. It's honestly baffling that a tech giant of this scale can't even get basic plugin stability right. For a company with billions in resources, this level of negligence is unacceptable.

"Sorry, an error occurred while generating a response"!!!!!!!!!!! Recent update has made the plugin completely unusable in agent/edit mode. It produces only broken garbage code that might have been from a correct LLM response, but is applied in a non-functional, non-salvageable way. Answers frequently cut out mid-stream and the overall stability is extremely poor, forcing us to retry and burning through our allotted usage. The UX becomes less reliable with every recent update, and our team’s trust in Copilot is dropping fast.

recent updates make this unusable - does this stuff not get tested...

don't make me hate pycharm!

Recent update has made the plugin completely unusable in agent/edit mode. Produces only broken garbage code that might have been from a correct LLM response, but applied in a non-fuctional, non-salvageable way. Overall UX is getting less reliable with each (recent) update. Trust in copilot is dropping fast in our team.
Una castaña, desde que metieron la actualización el chat no es funcional, no puedes ver todo lo que te escribe

Problems with last update. Android studio First when start new conversation with agent open old files.

Second doesn't see what agent do because not who last line
after latest update, entire conversation history wiped out!! this is just abysmal

Something has gone badly wrong in the past few days. It won't autocomplete at all. And when it does, it is completely wrong. I'm smashing ctrl-\ and it won't say a word. Maybe 1 / 5 times. It used to spit out absolute belters - full perfect functions - every second I stopped to think. What happened :(

Unfortunately, since WebStorm 2025.2, when this extension is opened, my CPU usage goes from 4-5% to 70%. This makes it almost unusable. I never expect this to be as good as its VSCode version, but c'mon guys, the money I spend on Copilot is the same regardless the IDE, it's up to you to deliver the proper experience.

Can this extension work for once? How different GitHub Copilot is from its VSCode 'brother' amazes me. The IntelliJ version has an abyssal difference, which, for the worst, should NOT be acceptable when one pays for its services. Aside from autocompletion, everything else is slower; only WHEN it decides to work its quality is incredibly questionable as well.

Get your stuff straight, GitHub!!!!
It is hoped that the project-level mcp.json configuration can be supported.

I use both tools in VSCode and in IntelliJ and this most frustrating thing I'm experiencing now is the fact that I can't make use of multiple instruction files, let alone have it pickup *.instructions.md files, which in my honest opinion is one of the biggest things to support, sure in small projects one copilot-instructions.md will suffice but in larger projects e.g. Android which benefit massively from splitting instructions based on glob patterns, e.g. you might have a lot of context for anything buildSrc/** and more patterns for more use cases.

The potential is there but just needs some TLC

Worked great up until the update of the plugin released. now it just Sign in for GitHub Copilot When you press that it makes a popup saying Retrieving GitHub Device Code and stays there. Paid the subscription and can't use. Oh well. It looks nice in the IDE, and adheres to the darkmode very well though.

The idea is great and if works fine as autocompletion, it also works in general. Just until it doesn't... The agent mode just blocks the IDE, the windows get frozen, I have to restart the whole IDE every other time I try the agent mode! That's frustrating and very annoying, because otherwise it could be a great plugin. If it worked.

The idea is great and if works fine as autocompletion, it also works in general. Just until it doesn't... The agent mode just blocks the IDE, the windows get frozen, I have to restart the whole IDE every other time I try the agent mode! That's frustrating and very annoying, because otherwise it could be a great plugin. If it worked.

The idea is great and if works fine as autocompletion, it also works in general. Just until it doesn't... The agent mode just blocks the IDE, the windows get frozen, I have to restart the whole IDE every other time I try the agent mode! That's frustration and very annoying, because it's otherwise a great plugin. If it worked.

I was excited initially when I saw the Copilot plugin for Rider. I tried it out and almost immediately I thought that Copilot didn't have the same functionality (or capabilities) to IDEs like Cursor, or Cline in VSCode.

Then I tried VSCode and VisualStudio's Copilot integration and it was miles ahead to Rider's. This is so unfortunate. I like have AI integration in the IDE that I use but its nowhere near as functional as in other IDEs and also feels like I can't really use it--its a poor implementation.

Please bring it up to parity!
Amazing update! Finally, on par with the good ones out there. MCP connectivity is good in my usige.

Works as expected, on Windows a little behind the VS code plugin in features though. Achieving very good results with GPT 4.1 and GPT5 Judging from the reviews (aside from the bugs that we have not seen in our team), it seems that training on how to use LLMs effectively is still very much needed.

This plugin has completely gone to shit. It is close to the point of being unusable. Half of the time it just says: sorry an error has occurred. 90% of the rest of the time the code gets completely broken. The rest it just refuses to follow simple orders. Then a lot of times it runs out of context window, even using Gemini. The same task doing it in the Gemini app works perfectly. Github copilot has seriously fucked up their implementation. Also, it was never good, but never as bad as now. And also, how the fuck do we ask for a refund? there is no link to support anywhere
Unable to open MCP settings. Endless spinner.

I have to say, Copilot has helped me a lot, but now it clearly can't handle some tasks. First, when I ask about a file of mine that has a thousand lines of code in agent mode, it quickly shows “the token limit exceeded.” Okay, I can understand that. But every time I’m about to start a new conversation, all the files that were changed in the last chat pop up and ask if I want to apply the changes — come on, I have dozens of files!
Unable to open MCP settings, forever loading, does not handle well if you manually change things and then accept/discard changes.
I wont renew subscription any more, it just no use.....
I didn't have to read the documentation ... it works like charm ... Agent is magic ... transform written word to code ...

UX Issue - I am using dual display setup on my Mac. So i have an extra display where i keep Copilot in Window mode. I always give my prompts from this Copliot window in secondary monitor and do coding on my main screen. But the problem occurs when in,switches my focus from Copilot window to my Android studio editor. It automatically hides the copilot window when the Studo editor gains focus. This happens because the focus switches from Copilot text field to Android studio editor field.If i had removed focus from Copilot editor to another area in copilot by clicking anywhere else in Copilot and then select Android studio editor , it doesnt happen.

Installation did not work on PyCharm 2025.0.1.

"Download and Install": Plugin "GitHub Copiulot" download or installation failed.

Nice when it works. Sometimes tends to completely mess up your project. Discarding changes only works half of the time and if it doesn't you often end up with Frankenstein files, that make no sense. I had enough today, after it deleted all my local changes
Sorry,an error occurred while generating a response.
Why in the world each time i open a new session it opens me like 20 tabs with stuff i modified in previous sessions? some times it makes it crash

"Edit" mode worked great for the first few hours, but now it gives me a "Failed to map code for uri with result type filtered" error every time I try to use it. I asked ChatGPT how to fix it. It said that it is a known issue and gave some recommendations. I tried them but nothing worked. It will only let me use "Ask" mode now, which is disappointing. I am on macOS Sequoia. It's also disappointing that you can't add line breaks to your query. When you hit enter/return, it submits the query. You should be able to hit Shift+Enter/Return to add line breaks.

Constantly broken itself, and breaking the editor behaviour. Many issues getting solved by just disabling the Copilot plugin. Being tired of figuring out whose fault is that, JetBrains or Microsoft, so planning to get rid of the IntelliJ altogether and just use VS Code.

Save yourself the hassle and have Visual Code open alongside your IDE to handle AI tasks and use Jetbrains IDE's for manual work. Models seem to be missing. If I give it a list of files to work on it often ignores most of them or stops after the first few. I think the terminal commands are broken and it doesn't warn you.

It seems that it can not maintain a conversation. I tried GPT-4o, GPT-4.1, Sonnet 3.7, Sonnet 3.7 Thinking, and Sonnet 4. The most I got was 3-4 requests under the same conversation, and then the conversation loses context of the previous questions and answers. In most cases, I can not have more than one prompt related to the previous. The files provided as context are not lost though. You can not have a "real conversation" - you have to start over and try to put all previous discussions under the same prompt.
High cpu taking. Empty result today. I will unsubscribe.
Many lags, frequent crashes, ignorance of users' bug reports. Rating is deserved enough.

JetBrains' Copilot and VSCode's Copilot are completely different. The same prompt generates very poor results in the code editor. Since both provide Copilot plugins, they should at least perform better instead of being like half-finished products, resulting in a very poor experience.
Laravel Boost doesn't detect Github Copilot! In PhpStorm uses global msp.json instead of workspace msp.json
plugin kills the webstorm (validated with intelij support) also no convinient side window oveflow the chat width when opening two tabs side to side
Dataspell copilot chat에서 줄 바꿈이 안됩니다.

Wasted over an hour chasing down why my visual guide was screwed up and my indent guides were now missing after installing this plugin. It is unconscionable that an AI coding plugin would mess with the IDE color scheme, setting the font to a proportional font instead of a monospaced one, and disabling the background color for the Matched brace guide.

It took forever to chase down these settings which I'd originally set up many, many years ago and finely tuned to how I liked it.
Keep running into "Oops token limit exceeded, please start a new chat".
The latest update added support for GPT-5 but I can't select GPT-5 from the list.

PhpStorm uses global msp.json instead of workspace msp.json

When using Laravel Boost inside PhpStorm (with GitHub Copilot enabled), the plugin is using the global msp.json config from ~/config/github-copilot/intellij/msp/msp.json instead of the workspace config located in the project root.
